page.title: 09EVENTS_MINERS STRIKE
page.content: {1st March 1984 the closure of Cortonwood Colliery was announced, sparking off a long, bitter dispute.Flying pickets visited Nottinghamshire and in May mounted police charged a picket of several thousand miners at nearby Orgreave Coking Plant. In October a solitary miner returned to work at Cortonwood where on 8th Nov. fighting broke out between pickets and police. Windows smashed; lamp-posts up rooted; materials set on fire. On 29th Jan. 85, 3000 pickets again clashed with 2000 police. Fighting extended to the side streets of Brampton with a mounted police charge up Knollbeck Lane. Cars and trailers set on fire. Police withdrew; some badly injured. Riots continued into Feb. Shops boarded up. Police van set on fire. Returned to work 5th March 85
